titleproper.value:
Guide to the Sidney Kaufman Audio Collection
                    <num>ALBA.AUDIO.058</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Jenny Pondo

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2012-03-29T09:58-0400</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: Sidney Kaufman served in the International Brigades in Spain from July 1937 through February 1939. Kaufman later served in World War II transporting troops in the South Pacific. He was a lifelong member of the Marine Cooks and Stewards Union and the International Longshoremen's and Warehousemen's Union. The collection contains three audio cassettes of Kaufman discussing his time in Spain.

p.value:
Elizabeth C. Compa, "Sid Kaufman's Odyssey out of Spain," 
                <emph render="italic">The Volunteer</emph>, June 2005.
The tapes, made in 1977, consits of Kaufman discussing his time in Spain, and reading from the journal he kept while trying to find a way out of Spain.
